skill.name: tdd-workflow
skill.description: Test-Driven Development methodology for Node.js/TypeScript projects.
skill.summary: Test-Driven Development methodology for Node.js/TypeScript projects.
skill.author: DoubleslashSE

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with TDD guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no file system modifications. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misclassifying markdown code fence delimiters as Ruby backticks and test pattern terminology as security threats.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code leads to gaps in coverage and fragile designs. This skill guides you through the disciplined RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle to build tested, well-designed Node.js and TypeScript applications from the start.
actual_capabilities: Guide the RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle step by step
Enforce test naming conventions and AAA pattern
Provide test double patterns (mock, stub, fake, spy)
Suggest project structure for test organization
Identify and fix common TDD anti-patterns
limitations: Does not generate production code directly
Focused on Node.js and TypeScript specifically

use_cases.title: Build features with TDD
use_cases.description: Implement new features by writing failing tests first, then making them pass, then refactoring.

use_cases.title: Create test scenarios
use_cases.description: Design effective test cases using naming conventions, AAA pattern, and parameterized tests.

use_cases.title: Add tests safely
use_cases.description: Introduce tests to existing codebases by understanding test doubles and fixture patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic TDD cycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me apply TDD to implement a [feature name]. Guide me through RED-GREEN-REFACTOR.

prompt_templates.title: Write failing test
prompt_templates.prompt: I am in the RED phase. Write a failing Jest test for [method name] with [scenario] expecting [behavior].

prompt_templates.title: Make test pass
prompt_templates.prompt: My test is failing. Help me write minimal production code to pass the test without over-engineering.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor safely
prompt_templates.prompt: My test passes. Help me refactor this code for better design while keeping all tests green.

output_examples.input: Help me apply TDD to create a discount calculator
output: 1. Start with RED: Write a failing test for CalculateDiscount(100, 10) expecting 90
3. Refactor: Extract constants, add validation, improve naming
4. Continue: Add tests for edge cases (0%, 100%, invalid input)

output_examples.input: How do I test an async function with Jest?
output: Use async/await with expect async assertions:
- Or use fake timers for testing timeouts and delays
- Always return promises in tests to ensure completion

best_practices: Write one failing test at a time before writing any production code
Keep production code minimal in GREEN phase, improve design only in REFACTOR
Run tests after every change to maintain the safety net
anti_patterns: Testing implementation details instead of behavior
Using mocks for everything without understanding trade-offs
Skipping the REFACTOR phase and leaving ugly code

faq.question: What test frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Jest, Vitest, and Mocha. Focus is on Jest as the most popular Node.js testing framework.

faq.question: What are the limits of TDD for this skill?
faq.answer: TDD works best for business logic. UI, integration, and database code require different approaches.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing project?
faq.answer: The skill guides workflow. You need Jest or your chosen framework installed and configured.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. It does not read, write, or transmit any files.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing?
faq.answer: Check test setup, assertions, and dependencies. The skill helps identify common mistakes.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill enforces the full TDD cycle with specific patterns for Node.js and TypeScript.
